author: Staff Reporter
text:
Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research (Jipmer) felicitated Dr. K. Mathangi Ramakrishnan, chairperson, Kanchi Kamakoti CHILDS Trust Medical Research Foundation for her contribution and services for burn patients.

Jipmer Director S.C.Parija stated in a press release on Friday that she was felicitated during the Jipmer Sushruta Oration in Plastic Surgery organised by the Department of Plastic Surgery.

Dr. Ramakrishnan is a paediatric plastic surgeon and a former head of the Department of Burns, Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery at Kilpauk Medical College, Chennai. She is credited with several medical papers published in peer reviewed medical journals.

Ravi Kumar Chittoria, Head of the Department of Plastic Surgery, said that Jipmer Sushruta Oration in Plastic Surgery is being organised every year for the last four years. Dr. S. Mahadevan, Dean Academics and Dr. Vishnu Bhatt, Dean Research, highlighted the contribution of Dr. Ramakrishnan in the care of paediatric (children) burns. She is a recipient of Sushruta Gold Medal from the Sushruta Society of India, Hari Om Ashram Award from the Association of Surgeons of India and the Lifetime Achievement Award of the National Academy of Burns India. She was honoured by the Government of India, in 2002, with the fourth highest Indian civilian award of Padma Shri.

The Tamil Nadu government recently honoured Dr. Ramakrishnan with the Avvaiyar Award for the year 2014.
title: Jipmer honours doctor for service to victims of burns
